channel.title: Scar compile?
channel.description: scar should be made so that it can compile the scripts into an .exe, that would make it so much better...

item.title: Scar compile?
item.dc:creator: @superstuntguy superstuntguy
item.description:
@superstuntguy wrote:

well, how bout you only have to have a scar script, and a miniscar.

Miniscar doesnt have to be installed, just open miniscar, drag the scar file onto a special ole window, and it can run it, all scripts would use a kind of info format, eg
{SETUP
name=Powerminer
description=Mines any ore and drops
iron=boolean
coal=boolean
copper=boolean
tin=boolean
SETUP}
that would be generated by scar into a window that tells you what it is, can set colors and choose client, lets you set vars with input boxes, then use them like regular variables, leecher friendly. and you can just look at the scar file with notepad or regular scar.

my idea may not make sense, so feel free to ask questions, and if any one could write the functions for scar and put them in a dll, I could make a vb app that did this.

Read full topic

item.title: Scar compile?
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

iruleatants:

scar should be made so that it can compile the scripts into an .exe, that would make it so much better…

Why? Actually thats not a good idea at all in my oppinion.

If they did that, then how would anyone learn to script? The best way it tearing apart scripts, if they were all exe’s then we wouldnt be able to modify them to fit our needs or anything. Plus, anyone could encrypt a password logger or something, it would be undetctable by virus scanners and we wouldn’t know it was stealing passwords because we wouldnt have access to the source code. On top of that, what is good about having it as an exe? I see no reason in doing so.

Read full topic
